column12: How the hell am I supposed to know where to put this?

column14: ve been here before, and that I&rsquo
column15: ve just been roaming in circles. The shelves seem taller now, looming more and more/ The overhead lights shut down to low levels casting shadows upon me. And I find myself in the near dark still holding onto this thing as cardboard boxes with pictures of giggling babies surround me. A cold chill runs up my spine as fear starts to set in. But it&rsquo
column16: s got to go somewhere, so I head back in there, deeper into the aisles. Forever searching aimlessly, pleading with higher powers for a sign, or some clue as to where this thing goes.
column17: And then I see myself lost to this dark world. Never to be seen again.
column18: Old employees will tell future ones that on the cold nights you can still hear my pained mutters as I groan &lsquo
column21: where the fuck does this go?&rsquo

column1: event,"I'll admit, after a holiday season of explaining video games to guest at work I'm pretty tired of social interaction with people that don't know about the things their buying.&nbsp

Seriously Nintendo... why did you make the Wiimote and Nun-chuck sold separately and so confusing to non-gamers? If I had a nickle for every time I had to explain them I'd buy the Moon and bring it down on you guys! &nbsp

Anyway getting back to my story I was pretty tired of people, and tonight I had a guest that had just picked up a PSP for himself and was asking a bunch of questions. Yeah, I know it was new to him, but as I said, I was tired of these sorts of questions, but I'm on the job so I'm polite and answer everything I can. I just hate him a little more inside each time.&nbsp

Then he comes up to me with a pinball game and asks me about something I don't know. So we read the back of the case. Turns out that according to the back of the game there are some actual old pinball game boards on the game. And his face lights up. That look of someone that's found something that's pure gold if only to them. And that made me smile right back.
I might still not know much about pinball, but I know that look and it's nice to be reminded we all have our thing.
event,"Damn it... it's in my system now.
This holiday season has been made of the suck. It really has.&nbsp

I'm at a store I don't really care about that only has a handful of employees that I like. The guests here in Indy seem to be more rude and inpatient, and we're still not allowed to kill anyone as a warning.&nbsp
column2: At this point I was pretty sure my heart was dead inside.&nbsp

column1: I'm looking at the pile of gifts I've got set out for people. And in the analytical portion of my brain&nbsp
column2: I ponder for a second just ow much I've spent.

column1: But i can't. I look at the pile and just see the people I love and there's no price that could be put on that.
And I bow my head and realize that despite the horrors of the holiday season the good parts are still there and as strong as ever.
So I guess the moral of this is, despite how rough this time of year is, it's heart is in something good. Love your friend and family....
And wait till new years to strangle your enemies... at that point Santa's back to drinking and sleeping with elves and doesn't give a damn what you're doing.
event,"It's a word I don't think I've ever used before, but I'm living it.
For as far back as I can recall my goal is to make people laugh. To bring joy into people's lives.
I'm no comedian. I've got the worst timing in the world, and I'm nervous in groups, but I can draw, and with the worlds I create I can reach out and try to enrich peoples lives.
And here I've spent the day making people that are so important to me cry.

column2: Sorry Dutch, I'm sure when you asked me to post something new you wanted it to be happy.

column1: And while I have Wrath of the Lich King sitting on my desk as well as a new batch of my asthma meds.... I'm just not feeling the joy.
Maybe some sleep and some Bast and I'll feel better.
Good night, and before you turn in hug the ones you loves.
event,"I'm playing Disgaea on the PSP.
I know what happens, I know the dialogue almost by heart...
And still I get to the end for the big reveal and I choke up and start to sob as it unfolds...
*sigh* what am I to do with myself...

event,"

It was a long time ago in a far away land&hellip
column2: or maybe it was a couple weeks back in the kitchen downstairs&hellip
column3: anyway, I had found myself in the kitchen with a dire need to feast upon something before death fell upon me&hellip
column4: or maybe I just needed a snack to tide me over till dinner either way, I was out of snacks and something had to be done!&rdquo
column6: Which ever may be the case, I&rsquo
column7: m certain I was fighting a space dragon before hand and totally kicked his ass!
column8: Now then, I find myself in the kitchen. I have slices of bread, and I have slices of cheese, and I tell myself, I&rsquo
column10: m a collage graduate, I manage to dress myself every day, and can explain video games and new fangled technologies to the elderly at work&hellip
column11: so why is making a grilled cheese sandwich really fuckin&rsquo
column15: do I need to get the grill? Can I grill it on the stove&hellip
column16: do I need to preheat the oven? What the fuck? Where are you when I need you God?&rdquo
column18: Being a strange and geeky artist type, I often feel awkward in my life outside of video games, but this was exceptionally weird. I remember there was a line in Mystery Science Theater 3000 where Crow mentions panicking while making sandwiches&hellip
column21: s a sandwich that needs to be made and I&rsquo
column24: d been previously living without a usable kitchen and forced to live off fast food and vending machines, but you&rsquo
column27: But alas it was. In the end disoriented and growing weak with hunger I have no choice but to curl up in a ball and cry until help arrived&hellip
column30: that was my adventure with trying to find a light bulb at Lowes&hellip
column31: this one I actually pulled through on and managed to grow ever so slightly as a functioning human being!
column32:
As it turns out, pop the bread into a toaster, set it on light, then take the toast slip the cheese in and then microwave for fifteen seconds and it is delicious!


-B!"

column1: So I'm going to take a break from it and play Disgaea...
event,"So... Sword of Omens versus the Sword of Power...

column2: Erica let me come over and play with her Brian!

column1: We had Chinese food, talkeda bout the shows on Adult Swim, quoted a whole lot of SeaLab 2021 and then watched the Japanese try and stop Godzilla from putting them in their place!&nbsp
Silly Japanese. You can't stop him, even with your blackhole gun!
Se says since we were good we can do it again sometime!
event,"It's three in the morning. I've just been soaking and playing Super Princess Peach (on loan from the Katie Collection), and as I'm brushing my teeth&nbsp
column2: it hits me.

column1: For starters I don't look good fresh out of the shower. My hair's slicked back. My eyes are all squinty from not having my glasses, and there's far too much pasty me to be seen.
And then I realize, that's got to be the truest sign of love.

If in the morning someone gets up with you, looks as your bedhead, your squinting eyes (most people I know need glasses), and take your horrible breath as you groan at the day-ball, and still say they love you. Then it's the real thing!
Me, I wake up to Bast going 'moaw!', which is probably cat for '

column2: GIVE&nbsp

column1: But I'm sure that's close to love too.
...and yes I'm playing the song as I type this...
Also, spell check does not appreciate lolcat..."

event,"

I'm working on a picture as I'm prone to do, and for it I'm needing to know the parts of meat that make up a cow. Granted the pig produces the best meat in the world, but it's not always about ham...
column2:
So I'm looking at Google, trying to figure out what to type in to figure out the cuts... and I end up typing 'beef map'. Which... worked, but I can't help but think that's the oddest thing I've typed into Google... at least this week...

So remember kids, if you ever need to know the part of meat that make up a cow, just look up 'beef map'!


-B!

"

column1:
event,"

Last night I'm chatting with my friend Rachael and we're jumping from topic to topic.
It the subjects go from my soul patch (that fuzzy thing under my lip because I can't grow actual facial hair... thank you Native American heritage...) and how I got the idea from the movie Iron Giant. And then I mention my favorite movie that Vin Diesel has done was Pitch Black.

Then I did mention how the follow up sucked. Then she looks at me and asked what they called the sequal 'Pitch Blacker?'

At which point I died laughing because I imagined a Black-plotation film with Samuel L. Jackson instead of Vin.

Pitch Blacker:
The Night Just Got Darker!

Now I'm expectiong you to say something Dutch because this touches on a few conversations we've had... and if you don't I'll send my Dadd to Iowa to finish the job he started in April!
column2:
)

-B!

column1: event,"Thank you when I needed you most.
You did not fail to deliver. I got to see new WarCraft stuff. I will buy so many minis when they come out this fall!
I have a new copy of Munchkin to play with! Munchkin Booty (Pirate stuff). Now I jsut need to wrangle the Brians and Erica to play.
I snagged a plush Link, so I can continue to be the best uncle ever to Katie... granted I am her only uncle...&nbsp
I got to see all sorts of neat dioramas... a love I someday have the space to explore.

column2: time with some Muncie friends and Indy firends. Something I never get enough of. I realize I often bitch and moan that no one loves me, but I kow they do. Granted I'm sure Vader can't feel love, but I'm sure he feels... less scorn for me than the rest of the world.

column1: And most of all I got to see an old old friend. Although I suppose I'm the older one...&nbsp
Also I had tacos for dinner. Always a good way to end things.
event,"I think one of the things that has gotten be down lately is my lack of interaction with friends.
Sure, I've been hanging out with my brother more, but that also means spending time with his screaming brood... and since I'm not alowed to kick&nbsp
column2: my nephew's face in... this makes the visits less than enjoyable.

column1: So hurry up GenCon! I need this time with freaks and weirdos such as myself!

event,"

Why do I fall for women that have boyfriends and live in distant states?

When will I be able to drill it into my head that the universe doesn't have anyone in it for me...

Poorbably doens't help I'm still too poor to ever buy a PS3... so I can't even play more Ratchet and Clank... at least I know they love me... when I can pay for them...

event,"Years upon years ago, in the far away land of Muncie, I worn through a pair of sandals. And so I did like I had done every previous year and perchased a new pair, but this pair... this pair I was not prepared for.
Picking the wrong size I found this pair was far too big and would slip off if&nbsp
column2: I stepped wrong, or tried to run, or tried a kick something. Although the added projectile attack made the kick all the more effective...&nbsp
column3: but being a guy I refused to return anything...&nbsp
column5: wear then until they died on me and get a new pair. After all... the others would last a year or so and then die...&nbsp
column7: not get that last part... they just wouldn't die. They were the Wolverine or James Bond of&nbsp

column1: No matter what I did they just kept surviving! Day in, and day out. Walking all over campus, mowing, walking in and out of comic and toys stores. I even went on vacations in the&nbsp
column2: things hopping that would spead along their demise.&nbsp

column1: I put those damn things through their paces and they refused to give in. If anything it strengthened their resolve... although what sandals are doing with resolve is beyond me.&nbsp

So there I'd be walking along with my ill-fitting sandals explaining to friends and family I was just going to wear them till they died and that while I could just get rid of them I've got principles! And refuse to waste money on sandals that I could be wasting on comic books... like the Hulk! Oooo I can't wait to see the next issue. Who is Red Hulk?
Anyway this continued on for years. To the point where I had just settle on living with them. They weren't budging, and neither was I.&nbsp

So I'm home working on some pictures throughout the day until I figure I need some sort of cooked meat and decide on a White Castle run. I head downstairs and to the door where I keep my sandals, but instead of finding them as usual I find their scattered remains. Seemingly torn to shreds... but how... was it one of the cats? What it my roommate Liz... or possibly the massive Golden Retriever I also live with... it just boggles the mind...&nbsp
But either way, the war has ended, and while I might not be able to take credit for the sandal's defeat, I can at least take pride in the knowledge that I outlasted them!"

event,"

Wii Fit is not only a jerk that calls me names, but it's also turning me into a monster!

To start off after the initial testing it looks me over and says I'm overweight and have the balance of a 56 year old...
column2:
Then after I started crying to pointed and laughed then beat me up and stole my juice money... I wont even tell you want the thing did to my brother... I only hope Stu has the strength to carry on with his life...

Not only that though, but when I started witht he training I decided to do something light, like the hoola-hoop game. So I play through and get the hang of it, and then pass it onto my neice since it's her turn.
column3:
So right off the bat she wants to give the hoola-hoop game a try too, but when she starts it instead of the full hip rotaion needed she's just swaying back and forth. So Stu and I tell her she needs to move around on the balance board, but she's not getting it. So I slip behind her and put my hands on her hips and try moving her in a circle.

I then sigh and look over at my brother
column5:
am I one of those creepy touchy-feely uncles now?'

He looks back and smirks,
column6:
'Looks like it.'

So see, Wii Fit is not only mean, but it also turns you into a bad uncle!

-B!

PS For thoughs that don't know I'm joking around with this, when given a chance Katie will climb me like I'm part of her
column7: jungle gym. So before anyone calls me out on this, she stared it!

Way to go Japan, you are both fuckin' insane and pure awesome!


-B!

And... and I still haven't been attacked by that dragon that I pissed off... and... ummm... yeah...

event,"

Carter Caves, one of my most favorite vacation spots on the Earth... And less than an hour there we go on a walk to the Fern Bridge, possibly my favorite spot in the park and while walking around a take a step on a slick rock, trying to avoid some mud. The next thing I know I'm landing full force on my hip... and I tell you there's nothing like a pain when you first start walking to remind a fellow just how much they like sitting around and drawing.
column2:
)

But all in all it was a fantastic vacation, got to see my family and hang out with my friend Dutch. And although my father tried to kill us out there in that scenic forest by taking the road less traveled... if ever traveled...
column3:
it was still a great adventure!

Also, if you happen to have a can of pringles and are around a squirrel, give 'em some! They love 'em. Especially barbecue!

-B!

column1:
event,"
This is a bit from a discusion on a message board of mine where a British friend was begrudging the fact that often in the cinema the villains are British, but I looked at it in a more possitive light:

The stereotypical British person is a classy well versed and spoken man in a suit and top hat with interesting facial hair (where else in the world will you find mutton chops?) that'll be rather charming as he explains why he's going to crush all the governments and rule the world:

""Soon my good man the device shall be complete, and then you'll understand the machinations of my intentions and why I shall control every man woman and child upon this Earth... excluding those that will be dead of course. Winford, my tea please.""
column2: On the other hand if we go with the stereotypical American you're going to have a fat guy with shabby facial scruff in a NASCAR shirt with a beer most likely
column3:
you in his hand (not even a good brand either, probably something you can only find in cheep gas stations along the back road where you never EVER wanna drive). :

""An' once my big f*ckin' cannons done I'm gonna show you som'ah'bitches who's in charge! Sugar-Pop, get yer daddy anoth'ah beer!""


Seriously, which would you want threatening the planet?


Although personally I'd prefer a pirate, hooked hand, missing eye, parrot on his shoulder and a beard you could hide booty in. While wearing a lavish coat you'd call girlie, but damnit he's for a sword, a gun, and that hook!:
column4: Yarr! Once this cannon be complete no port 'ill be able ta withstand my attacks! An' then the sea's 'ill be mine fer tha plunderin'! Squiggins, bring me another ale!""

column2: Tomorrow at the toy store we will have Wii's... and I'll be there for an eight hour shift.

column1: So if I don't make it out alive, tell WarCraft I love it!
...thirteen hours till we open and counting...

event,"

Is is common with Febuary, there's not a whole lot ot do in the toy store, especially in the electronics department.
The morning started out with me doing a little rearranging in the movies and the games, and then it looked like it was going to be another day of drawing things behind the counter... turns out fate would not be so kind!

Instead I was to help sort out the expired candy. So traveled far from the saftey of the R-Zone booth (where we keep all the extra stuff), the the candy storage area... which actually didn't take long because it's the same room.
column2:
From the I was set before a mountain of candies and told to toss the old candy, but first cut off the UPC code and put those away so we can turn them in for credit witht eh suppliers... sounds easy enough... but saddly I'm not a skilled man when it comes to box cutters. Which is probably why I cut open boxes with keys... pens, rulers, stray ducks, or whatever I can find.

And since I realize this is a boring story I'll cut to the chase and say at least two of the fingers on my right hand are not bleeding... but at least I've learned that expired candy is out for blood!

Don't let it expire! Buy it before it goes bad!

-B!

"

column1:
event,"

I finally remembered my password so I can start posting random thoughts once more!

Woot!

-B!

"

event,"

Sadly, not a whole lot going on at the moment outside the normal. So lots of drawing and some playing Pokemon.
But I certainly don't mind the stabilty. Don't get me wrong.

I find it a bit of a shame I didn't work on the Halo 3 release. I bet that must have been fun, but I did get to see my uncle and brother yesterday and have Pizza King. It was cute, at one point it was my uncle, myself, and my nephew at the table, which means we had the second born for three generations sitting there.

Now I should get back to the art stuffs. I'm thinking I need a new big project to get the creative juices flowing.
Although I'll be hard pressed to top this thing: http://www.supermegatopia.com/gallery/gallery.php?thisLink=furrycrossover.jpg

-B!

"

event,"

So I'm visiting my brother this Sunday, and I'm just about to play on his Wii, when his dogs come in. Sam is... huge. At least half my weight and then some and Skippy, while smaller is not a small dog. And after some backing Skippy gets over the fear she has of all new people, then starts wanting attention.

Sitting ont he couch I'm suddenly pushed back as Sam decides he wants to sit on my lap and Skippy qquickly comes in fromt he left side. Soon all I can see is black fur pressing into me. I reach an arm up and call to Stu for a little help and only he chuckles.

I'm sure on the other end it was cute to see...

...and I was able to get a minimate of Speed Racer and the Mach 5 for 1.57 at Toys'R'Us thanks to clerance, but discount card, and a coupon. Best Sunday I've had in ages! Woot!

And for those that don't know, minimates are my little addiction.
column2: Here's some of the Avengers in Minimate form:
column3:
http://actionfigureinsider.com/main/wp-content/uploads/Minimates16.jpg

I don't count them, otherwise I'd have an idea how much I've spent on them...

Laters!

B!

"

column2:
FONT-FAMILY: Arial"">I got the new They Might be Giants (the Else).

Listened a few times to the whole thing, then uploaded my new faves to my iPod (which I won for being awesome), then got to work finishing the inks on an art commission and it occurs to me, that while parts of my weekend sucked, there was this happy little moment where I was listen to music as I worked and felt better.

So I guess I just gotta remember that even when life is turbulent there are always those moments of joy to hold onto and those will carry you through...

...or maybe I'm just insane.
column5:
FONT-FAMILY: Arial"">Either or I'm better than before.

-B.

column2: I wouldn't say today has left me broken... but I am feeling a little worse for wear.

column1: But I got my pages done and the new They Might Be Giants CD.
I will take what victories I can get!
...also if you have a chance to play Raving Rabids do it! The game is wacked, but a lot of fun.
Turns out I can milk a video game cow and ride a warthog... but not at the same time.

event,"

As it turned out I had to be to work an hourand a half earlier, so I was only able to get a page and a half done.
But on the bright side my brother said not to worry. So once I got home from work I was able to play World of WarCraft with my friend Dutch and will finish up that last little bit when I'm visitiing with Stu later today.

I'm also going to hunt down that new They Might Be Giants CD.

Today looks like it could be a lot of fun!

B!

"

event,"

Well I've got five hours before work to see if I can may pages to Knights of the Dinner Table finished up.
Oh there's nothing like the looming horror of a deadline sitting on your shoulder to motivate you!

-B!
